solution: Judy went to the store
to buy some bread,
but they didn't have any.
she bought a cake instead.
the man jumped over the mountain,
or so he thought.
but when he landed on the other side
and looked behind himself
he saw that it was just an ant hill
one night two frogs found themselves in a dairy.
hopping and jumping around as frogs do
they both jumped into a milk pail half full of milk.
after swimming around for some time
they tried to get out.
but the inside of the pail was too slippery
and there was nothing on which they could rest
so that they could jump out.
one frog thought it was useless trying to swim on
and just gave up hope and sunk and was drowned.
the other carried on swimming
hoping against hope that something would turn up.
he swam and he swam until he began to feel tired.
but by this time the milk which was full of cream had become thick.
when the frog had swum some more
the cream had been stirred so much
that it became a solid lump of butter.
on this the frog could scramble and rest.
and from it he could easily jump out of the pail into safety.

data: once there was a little boy
who lived in a hot country.
one day his mother told him
to take some cake to his grandmother.
She warned him
to hold it carefully
so it wouldn’t break into crumbs.
the little boy put the cake in a leaf under his arm
and carried it to his grandmother’s.
when he got there
the cake had crumbled into tiny pieces.
his grandmother told him
he was a silly boy
and that he should have carried the cake on top of his head
so it wouldn’t break.
then she gave him a pat of butter
to take back to his mother’s house.
the little boy wanted to be very careful with the butter
so he put it on top of his head
and carried it home.
the sun was shining hard
and when he got home
the butter had all melted.
his mother told him that
he was a silly boy
and that he should have put the butter in a leaf
so that it would have gotten home safe and sound.
stories.title: Story1

data: once there was a little girl
who lived in a cold country.
one day her mother told her
to take some milk in a glass jar to her grandfather.
She warned him
to keep it warm
so it wouldn't freeze.
the little boy put the milk
and carried it to his grandfather's.
when she got there
the glass had cracked.
her grandfather told her
she was a silly girl
and that he should have carried the cake under her arm
so it wouldn't freeze.
then he gave her an ice cream cone
to take back to her mother's house.
the little girl wanted to be very careful with the ice cream
so she put it in her shirt
and carried it home.
and when she got home
the ice cream had all melted.
her mother told her that
she was a silly girl
and that he should have put the ice cream on her head
so that it would have stayed nice and cold.
stories.title: Story2
